Author: Bitcoin Benny#9597
Content:
I, as you all know, remain quiet and prefer to speak about facts. I don‚Äôt complain and don‚Äôt explain. All I can say, is that they are serious allegations about someone we all work with. I for one put my head down and my bum up at all times, and I am firmly of the belief that you respond to what warrants responding to. I value my words so I always choose them very carefully. We have enough to focus on with the development of tech and with running the day to day. There is no time to become involved in such trivial matters, nor is there the need to divert any effort into addressing such matters.
We all have a job to do and we go back to what we have been doing well for an exceptionally long period of time. We focus on the right things and the things that matter. There is a saying used when navigating the Vietnamese traffic. ‚ÄúKeep your eyes on the road in front of you, and let the traffic behind you take care of itself‚Äù.

Author: jansako#3330
Content: The trouble seems to be with the fact that there is a conflict between the 'open and decentralized' nature of KMD and the need to make executive decisions that by nature require a hierarchy (corporate--like or otherwise). Without clearly communicated internal rules it becomes confusing for people on the inside, then add the (lack of) face to face cooperation and collaboration that exists in this space.  Then people bring in their ideas of 'what should be' instead of the clearly articulated 'what is'.
